Description: Calcite kohl-jar with a circular lid; the rim has been repaired from fragments.
Curator's comments: Published: Les amour d'une princesse égyptienne, Saint-Gérard 1997, pp.121, 153 [84]. Sacred Food, Barcelona 2001, pp. 186-187 [50]

On kohl-containers, see Egypt’s Golden Age (exhibition catalogue, Boston, 1982): 216-27, with no.263 from Zawiyet el-Aryan as an example similar in form to EA 29336. See Aston, Ancient Egyptian Stone Vessels (SAGA 5), 148 for other excavated examples, all of 18th dynasty date.
Exhibition history: Exhibited: 1997 May-Oct, Abbaye Saint-Gerard De Brogne, Le Roman de la momie
Acquisition name: Purchased from: R J Moss & Co
